questions.question: What is the fundamental frequency of a square wave if its period is 0.02 seconds?

explanations.a: Correct! The fundamental frequency is calculated as \( f = \frac{1}{T} \), where \( T \) is the period.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This is not the correct calculation for the fundamental frequency.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This is not the correct calculation for the fundamental frequency.
explanations.d: Incorrect. This is not the correct calculation for the fundamental frequency.

questions.question: Which harmonics are present in a square wave?

explanations.a: Correct! A square wave contains only odd harmonics (1st, 3rd, 5th, etc.).
explanations.b: Incorrect. A square wave does not contain even harmonics.
explanations.c: Incorrect. A square wave contains only odd harmonics.
explanations.d: Incorrect. A square wave has harmonics.

questions.question: What is the relationship between the amplitude of the harmonics and their frequency in a square wave?

answers.d: Amplitude is zero for all harmonics

explanations.a: Correct! The amplitude of the harmonics decreases as the frequency increases.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The amplitude does not increase with frequency.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The amplitude varies with frequency.
explanations.d: Incorrect. There are non-zero amplitudes for the harmonics.

questions.question: If the fundamental frequency of a square wave is 100 Hz, what is the frequency of the third harmonic?

explanations.a: Correct! The third harmonic is three times the fundamental frequency: \( 3 \times 100 \text{ Hz} = 300 \text{ Hz} \).
explanations.b: Incorrect. This is the frequency of the second harmonic.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This is the fundamental frequency.
explanations.d: Incorrect. This is not the correct calculation for the third harmonic.

questions.question: What is the phase shift of the harmonics in a square wave compared to the fundamental frequency?

answers.b: All harmonics are 90 degrees out of phase
answers.c: All harmonics are 180 degrees out of phase

explanations.a: Incorrect. The harmonics are not all in phase with the fundamental.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The phase shift is not uniform across all harmonics.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The phase shift is not uniform across all harmonics.
explanations.d: Correct! Harmonics have varying phase shifts relative to the fundamental frequency.
